question:
you have received a bill from a mobile phone company for international call charges relating to a time when you did not use your phone for international calls.
write a letter to the company,
complaining about this 
giving your reasons 
asking for the bill to be changed
text: I am writing this letter with regret to inform you about the excess amount charged against  international calls for which I did not make any of those in my entire life. Hence, I was terrified after looking into a monthly invoice and bringing this issue to your kind notice immediately without any further damage to me.

As you know, I am wondering what could go wrong and how  those calls connected despite  the very low credit to my account. However, I strongly believe that there may be a big scam behind this cybercrime as this was done without my presence. In addition, you may go ahead and  do an  investigation to find out the fact and I would really appreciate it if you do file a complaint at the nearest police department.

Undoubtedly, this will cost me an eye and a leg to pay the bill and I am not sure how to make this payment. Hence, request you to please consider my situation and make a new bill with the actual amount I am ready to make this payment with super urgency since this is in my budget.
I look forward to hearing your reply with an adjustment of my invoice amount.
